ruleml:Atom.ruleml:Rel: Use floor area is the total building use floor area including that occupied by internal partitions and fixtures
( building_use(boiler_room) OR building_use(plant_room) OR building_use(service_unit) OR building_use(maintenance_workshop) )
buildings and parts of buildings with intermittent use
( building_use(manufacturing_area) OR building_use(process area) OR building_use(staff_room) )

( building_use(bedroom) OR building_use(bunkroom) OR building_use(detention_quarter) OR building_use(dormitory) OR building_use(hostel) OR building_use(hall) OR building_use(wharenui) OR building_use(ward_containing_more_than_two_beds) )
( purpose(furniture) OR purpose(floor_coverings) OR purpose(large_appliances) OR purpose(buiding_supplies) OR purpose(manchester) )
( building_use(shop_space) OR building_use(pedestrian_circulation_area) OR building_use(mall) OR building_use(arcade) )
( building_use(reading_room) OR building_use(writing_room) OR building_use(reading_lounge) OR building_use(writing_lounge) )

( building_use(office) OR building_use(banks) OR building_use(shops_staff_facilities) OR building_use(hotels_staff_facilities) OR building_use(bars_staff_facilities) OR building_use(any_other_building_use) )
( building_use(coffee_bar) OR building_use(tea_rooms) OR building_use(restaurants) OR building_use(bars) OR building_use(night_club) )
( building_use(club_room) OR building_use(assembly_hall) OR building_use(stadium) OR building_use(sports_venue) OR building_use(grand_stand) )
( building_use(boarding_house) OR building_use(hospital) OR building_use(prison) OR building_use(old_peoples_home) )
there is an accessible compartment (see Figure 8)
for each accessible unit there is one accesible shower
number of accesible showers and is provided in accordance with the needs of the occupants patients or treatment withtin the institution

( building_use(amusement_park) OR building_use(shopping_plaza) OR building_use(library) OR building_use(transport_terminal) OR building_use(coffee_bar) OR building_use(tea_room) OR building_use(restaurant) OR building_use(bar) OR building_use(night_club) OR building_use(office) OR building_use(bank) )
( building_use(church) OR building_use(club_room) OR building_use(assembly_hall) OR building_use(grandstand) OR building_use(museum) OR building_use(art_gallery) )
( building_use(hotel) OR building_use(hostel) OR building_use(motel) OR building_use(prison) OR building_use(boardinghouse) )
( building_use(hospital) OR building_use(old_people_home) OR building_use(community_housing) OR building_use(speciality_care_facility) )
( building_use(coffee_bars) OR building_use(tea_rooms) OR building_use(restuarants) OR building_use(bars) OR building_use(night_clubs) )
( building_use(amusement_parks) OR building_use(shopping_plaza) OR building_use(libraries) OR building_use(transport_terminals) )

( building_use(staff_facilities_for_offices) OR building_use(staff_facilities_for_banks) OR building_use(staff_facilities_for_shops) OR building_use(staff_facilities_for_hotels) OR building_use(staff_facilities_for_bars) OR building_use(staff_facilities_for_any_other_building_use) )
( building_use(place_of_active_recreation) OR building_use(swimming_pool) OR building_use(squash_court) OR building_use(gymnasium) )
Number of basins is provided in accordance with Commercial staff facilities
Number of WC pans is provided in accordance with Commercial staff facilities
Number of urinals is provided in accordance with Commercial staff facilities
Number of WC pans is provided in accordance with Commercial: staff facilities
Number of toilet facilities is provided in accordance with Commercial: amusement park shopping plaza etc
Number of facilities is provided in accordance with Commercial: staff facilities
combination of wc pans and urinals
Number of toilet facilities is provided in accordance with Commercial staff facilities
( building_use(boardinghouse) OR building_use(hospital) OR building_use(prison) OR building_use(old_people_home) )
combinations of WC pans and urinals
Number of toilet facilities is provided in accordance with Communal Residential: boardinghouse hospitals prisons old people s homes
building where people engage in active recreation
building where children under the age of five are supervised
building where children under the age of five are educated
building where people work in occupations where they get dirty and require showers before leaving work
facilities are located in a self contained compartment offering full privacy by way of full height doors and walls
exception to sanitary towel disposal equipment
facilities are located so that access is not via an area restricted to one sex
provision for sanitary towel disposal by either: a) Installing incinerators, macerators or similar disposal equipment, or b) Providing space for a portable disposal system
building which is used exclusively by preadolescents
The location impedes access for people with disabilities
The location is within the facility to serve one or more toilet cubicles
The location is in each toilet cubicle
WC system is firmly fixed in place
Bidet is firmly fixed in place
WC system has an impervious, easily cleaned surface finish (e,g, glazed earthenware or stainless steel)
Urinal has impervious, easily cleaned surface (e,g, glazed ceramic ware or stainless steel)
Bidet has an impervious, easily cleaned surface finish (e,g, glazed earthenware or stainless steel)
WC system has sufficient water trap volume to contain excreta from normal usage
WC system has a minimum water seal depth of 50 mm (see Figure 2)
WC system has a pan which will not overflow during a single flush even if the outlet blocks
WC system has a watertight flexible joint connecting the WC to a discharge pipe, The joint must be above floor level, and within the room containing the WC
WC system has a flushing apparatus capable of clearing all normal faecal matter from the pan in a single flush, and of delivering a full flush within 2 minutes of the previous usage
A flushing system for sanitary fixtures
flushing system use either cisterns or flushing valvesc
cistern has dual flush, 2 button type providing the choice of a full flush or a half flush
flushing valve has backflow prevention complying with G12/AS1, and a water supply capable of supplying several flushes in rapid succession
flushing valve has the capacity which is related to the nature and usage of the building
urinal is of the stall, continuous wall, trough or bowl type
urinal has at its base a channel or trough of sufficient size to receive all fluids discharging into it
urinal s channel drains to a trap at the lowest point where fluids shall enter a discharge pipe through a domed grate
urinal s grate has openings with a total area at least that of the discharge pipe, and be securely fixed but removable for maintenance access (see Figure 3)
urinal s front lip height is above the floor or step, no more than 600 mm for men and no more than 400 mm for boys
urinal s back surface extends at least 450 mm above the front lip level
constructed of 1,2 mm minimum sheet thickness of grade 304
constructed of 1,2 mm minimum sheet thickness of grade 316
Urinal flushing system has the cistern outlet at least 450 mm above the sparge pipe and comply with Table 5
Urinal s water supply complies with Table 5 and backflow prevention complies with NZBC G12
Manually operated flushing system has the operating control located no more than 1,3 m above the floor
Bidet is either over-rim feed type or submersible spray type
Bidet satisfies the provisions of NZBC G12 for backflow prevention
Showers using either a shower tray or a level threshold
howers satisfy the provisions of E3/AS1 Internal Moistur
Sanitary fixtures construction complies with the standard AS 1976 Vitreous china used in sanitary appliances
Sanitary fixtures construction complies with the standard AS 3588 Shower bases and shower modules
Sanitary fixtures construction complies with the standard AS/NZS 2023 Baths for ablutionary purposes
Sanitary fixtures construction complies with the standard AS/NZS 2023 Baths for ablutionary purposes
Sanitary fixtures construction complies with the standard AS/NZS 1730 Washbasins
Sanitary fixtures construction complies with the standard BS 3402 Specification for quality of vitreous china sanitary appliances
Spaces are separated from habitable spaces
WC pans are located in spaces having dimensions of no less than those shown in Figure 4
at least one door is provided between a soil fixture and a kitchen or a place for food storage
In buildings other than household units
no space containing a soil fixture is open directly into a space used for the storage, preparation, sale or consumption of food, see Figure 10
no space containing a soil fixture is open directly into an office or other work areas (as in factories), see Figure 10
Bassins are located in spaces containing a soil fixture, or in an immediately adjacent space
only a single door is provided between the soil fixture space and a kitchen in household units (see Paragraph 3,2,1)
a basin is provided within the soil fixture space
Sanitary fixtures are located in buildings separate from other accommodation
The length of travel is convenient taking account of the type and usage of the fixtures
Sanitary fixtures be located no more than 75 metres from any caravan or campsite
Sanitary fixtures for group dwellings are conveniently located for all occupants
Sanitary fixtures for people with disabilities
Sanitary fixtures for people with disabilities are signposted as required by NZBC F8 Signs
Sanitary fixtures for people with disabilities are located on an accessible route as required by NZBC D1 Access Routes
Fixtures for people with disabilities have the relevant layouts shown in Figures 5, 6, 7, 8 and 9
Spaces for people with disabilities have the relevant layouts shown in Figures 5, 6, 7, 8 and 9
the shower slider rod of an accessible shower compartment is firmly fixed in place
the adjustable shower assembly integrated with the grab rail of an accessible shower compartment is firmly fixed in place
Accessible showers have a level threshold
two or more toilet compartments are provided for wheelchair users
at least toilet compartment has a pan of the opposite hand
WC flushing control is easily operable
WC flushing control is positioned on the centre line or approach side of the WC pan
WC flushing control is higher than 1200 mm above the finished floor level
Operable privacy bolt (to indicate whether the toilet is occupied)
Operable privacy bolt is easily operable
Operable privacy bolt is higher than 1200 mm above the finished floor level
there is a wall hung pan
there is full access each side of the WC pan, as detailed in Figure 7, to allow for wheel-over access
there is full access each side of the WC pan, as detailed in Figure 7, to allow for wheel-over access
Wall in front of a concealed cistern extends no less than 1,0 m above floor level to provide back support
Soil fixtures that are not water flushed, such as those using chemicals or biological treatment
Soil fixtures are located where they will not cause a nuisance
privy is located at least 3,0 m from any building having a classified use, other than outbuildings or ancillary buildings
receptacle for excreta are is constructed to exclude flies
receptacle for excreta is fitted with a hinged lid
there is an access route or accessible route and a WC
There is no direct line of sight between the access route or accessible route and the WC
there is an access route or accessible route and a urinal
There is no direct line of sight between the access route or accessible route and the urinal
there is an access route or accessible route and a bath
There is no direct line of sight between the access route or accessible route and the bath
there is an access route or accessible route and a shower
There is no direct line of sight between the access route or accessible route and the shower
there is an access route or accessible route and a bidet
There is no direct line of sight between the access route or accessible route and the bidet
there is a space which contains more than one WC pan
each pan is enclosed in a separate cubicle
Screen walls and doors are have their upper edge at least 1600 mm above the floor, (see Figure 11)
Screen walls and doors are have heir lower edge between 150 mm and 300 mm above the floor (see Figure 11)
there is a general public area
there is a lobby between the space containing the sanitary facility and general public area to meet privacy and line of sight requirements
there is a lobby between the space containing the male sanitary facility and general public area to meet privacy and line of sight requirements
there is a lobby between the space containing the female sanitary facility and general public area to meet privacy and line of sight requirements
lobbies are independent for each sex
